content:
• Monday, November 5, 2012
  • SHCAY

    Shares of Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY) fall 3.9% in early Japanese trading after Standard & Poor's...

    Shares of Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY) fall 3.9% in early Japanese trading after Standard & Poor's cut its debt rating on the company by three notches to B+, and changed it's financial-risk profile to "highly leveraged" from "significant" on the back of last week's disappointing earnings announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 PM
  • SREV

    More on ServiceSource International (NASDAQ:SREV): Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up...

    More on ServiceSource International (NASDAQ:SREV): Q3 beats on a per share basis but comes up shy on revenue estimates, despite a 25% Y/Y jump in sales. Net losses widened on higher costs, and the company gave a muted view for the current quarter, due primarily to weak economic conditions, now expecting revenue of $62M to $64M. The Street was anticipating revenue of $72M. For the full year, the company lowered revenue guidance to $238M to $240M, down from its previous expectation of $246Mto $249M. Shares -15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM
  • EOG

    More on EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG): Q3 handily beat Street estimates on higher production volume...

    More on EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG): Q3 handily beat Street estimates on higher production volume and better oil prices, but net profit fell 34% Y/Y as the natural-gas and oil producer continues to rack up higher expenses. Total expenses climbed 21% to $2.35B. Crude oil and condensate revenue, the largest contributor to its top line, climbed 59%. However, natural gas liquids revenue fell 18%, while natural gas revenue slipped 26%. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 1 Comment

  • AK Steel (AK) +1.3% AH after announcing it will increase current spot market base prices...

    AK Steel (AK) +1.3% AH after announcing it will increase current spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products by $50/ton, effective immediately with new orders. It's AKS' second price increase for carbon steel products in three weeks.

    More on McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q3 misses bottom-line expectations despite a 17%...

    More on McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q3 misses bottom-line expectations despite a 17% jump in Y/Y sales. Net earnings surged on an increase in fabrication and marine activity in its Middle East and Atlantic segments. Order backlog came in at $5.3B, up from $4.3B a year earlier, but lower than the $5.7B recorded at the end of Q2. Shares -4.9% AH.

    More on Medifast (NYSE:MED): Q3 beats across the board on strong sales momentum across all units. Total sales were up nearly 20% Y/Y, while bottom-line results were boosted by better operating efficiencies and lower expenses. Shares +5.5% AH.

    More on EnerNOC's (NASDAQ:ENOC) Q3 results: Issues upside guidance for FY12, sees revenues of...

    More on EnerNOC's (NASDAQ:ENOC) Q3 results: Issues upside guidance for FY12, sees revenues of $270M-$280M vs. $264M consensus estimate and prior guidance of $260M-$280M, FY12 adjusted EBITDA seen at $15M-$20M vs. $5M-$20M previous guidance. Issues in-line guidance for FY13. ENOC +9.4% AH.

  • ARMH

    More on Apple/Intel: Apple engineers have "grown confident" their power-efficient ARM-based...

    More on Apple/Intel: Apple engineers have "grown confident" their power-efficient ARM-based chips will eventually be powerful enough for Macs, sources tell Bloomberg. Also, hardware engineering chief Bob Mansfield is reportedly interested in creating a more uniform experience between iOS and Mac OS. However, Apple is deemed "unlikely to switch in the next few years." To make a full switch, Apple needs to guarantee backwards-compatibility for existing software, something Microsoft didn't do with Windows RT. ARM (ARMH +2.7%) rallied on the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 33 Comments
  • CLNE

    More on Clean Energy (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q3 EPS loss comes in-line with estimates, but revenues miss...

    More on Clean Energy (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q3 EPS loss comes in-line with estimates, but revenues miss consensus slightly. Gallons delivered totaled 50.9M gallons, up 24% from 40.9M gallons delivered in the same period a year ago. Shares +1.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q3 EPS of $1.02 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $27B misses by $400M....

  • XCO

    Exco Resources' (XCO +2.4%) partnership deal with Harbinger (HRG +4%) gives XCO temporary relief...

    Exco Resources' (XCO +2.4%) partnership deal with Harbinger (HRG +4%) gives XCO temporary relief under the company’s debt covenants, but sets an "upper bound” for XCO's valuation, Jefferies says. The fields with which XCO is parting tend to produce more oil and gas liquids and have longer productive lives than the rest of its wells, "supporting our view that shares are overvalued."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +5.3%) expects most of the recent improvement in revenue generating levels of...

    Transocean (RIG +5.3%) expects most of the recent improvement in revenue generating levels of its rigs will be sustained next year, though rising costs remain a challenge across the industry due to the influx of new rigs and heavy activity soaking up spare labor and equipment. RIG expects revenue efficiency from continuing operations to average ~93% in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences Inc. (VTUS -9.8%) slides after getting FDA feedback requiring a second Phase...

    Ventrus Biosciences Inc. (VTUS -9.8%) slides after getting FDA feedback requiring a second Phase 3 study of its diltiazem hydrochloride cream - a treatment for anal fissures - before any new drug application can be filed. The drug developer says it expects to file the NDA following completion of the second Phase 3 study, with results expected early Q4 2013, and expects to file an NDA late in Q4 2013 with an anticipated PDUFA date near the end of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +1%) may have to pay a 4.7B real ($2.35B) tax claim related to the lease of...

    Petrobras (PBR +1%) may have to pay a 4.7B real ($2.35B) tax claim related to the lease of foreign offshore oil platforms after a judge threw out an injunction allowing it to avoid payment until a court challenge of the tax ruling was resolved. PBR had already warned shareholders it had not made provisions for the charge.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • UPS

    Shares of UPS (UPS -0.1%) fall back with a leak out tipping off EU regulators see a deal for TNT...

    Shares of UPS (UPS -0.1%) fall back with a leak out tipping off EU regulators see a deal for TNT Express creating competitive issues in nearly all 27 EU member nations. The last word from UPS was it still aims to close the multi-billion dollar transaction in early 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -14.2%) CEO Robin Raina uses a company PR to declare Bloomberg's report about an SEC...

    Ebix (EBIX -14.2%) CEO Robin Raina uses a company PR to declare Bloomberg's report about an SEC investigation "inaccurate and misleading" (no specifics are given), and state his company intends to "evaluate all avenues of recourse." The PR also notes Ebix, which delivers Q3 results on Thursday, expects to report "a strong performance in revenue and EPS" for the quarter. Shares are off their lows of the day, but remain down sharply.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -2%) shares are down again on concerns over debt reduction difficulties, but...

    Chesapeake (CHK -2%) shares are down again on concerns over debt reduction difficulties, but Canaccord keeps the faith that asset sales will keep debt in check. While believing CHK's proclamations are too optimistic, the firm thinks net debt-to-EBITDA should remain modestly under 3x through 2017 if CHK can just achieve the near-term goal of $2.5B-$3B in proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +8%) moves up on the back of on a positive article in Seeking Alpha...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +8%) moves up on the back of on a positive article in Seeking Alpha today, saying the stock looks "ridiculously overvalued" at current levels. Contributor Sean Anderson notes a number of potential catalysts to move the stock higher, but most significant is how little attention the stock currently gets on the Street, which could quickly change if of it's eteplirsen, a potential blockbuster treatment for Duchenne's disease, to receive early approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • WRK

    Rock-Tenn (RKT -1.4%) is downgraded to Neutral at J.P. Morgan as the most levered stock to...

    Rock-Tenn (RKT -1.4%) is downgraded to Neutral at J.P. Morgan as the most levered stock to potential containerboard price increases among paper and packaging stocks, and the impact of the most recent increase is reflected in the shares. IP -1.8%, KS -0.5%, PKG -0.3%. However, Wausau Paper (WPP-OLD +2.4%) is a notable outlier after 10% stakeholder Starboard Value Funds buys 75K shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • EXC

    Concerns over a potential dividend cut prompted Argus to cut Exelon (EXC -2.5%) to Hold earlier...

    Concerns over a potential dividend cut prompted Argus to cut Exelon (EXC -2.5%) to Hold earlier today. Jefferies beat them to the punch on Friday, downgrading the shares to Hold for the very same reason, noting that if forward pricing doesn't improve soon, the company isn't going to have any choice.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -6.8%) is off again today - shares are now down 20% since the local reviews leader...

    Yelp (YELP -6.8%) is off again today - shares are now down 20% since the local reviews leader issued its Q3 report. In addition to concerns about high expenses and low revenue for new accounts, the Street seems bothered by Yelp's forecast for Q4 display ad sales to be "flat-to-down"  Q/Q due to "execution challenges." Separately, GigaOm recently noted Yelp is responsible for many of the errors found in iOS 6 Maps' POI data.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • SYY

    Sysco (SYY -2.3%) dips after its FQ1 earnings missed the mark on a per share basis and its...

    Sysco (SYY -2.3%) dips after its FQ1 earnings missed the mark on a per share basis and its revenue narrowly slips by. Net earning fell 5.3% Y/Y as improved sales were largely offset by higher food and transportation expenses, plus increased charges related to its multiyear overhaul. Gross margin eased to 18.1% from 18.4%, while operating expenses were up 6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • PDCE

    PDCE Energy (PDCE -2.3%) is maintained at Buy at Canaccord but the firm cuts its production...

    PDCE Energy (PDCE -2.3%) is maintained at Buy at Canaccord but the firm cuts its production estimates 7% below prior guidance attributable to Wattenberg field gathering line pressure resulting from third-party midstream capacity limitations until the 110 MMcf/day LaSalle plant begins operation in mid-2013. The firm cuts its price target cut to $34 from $36.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +7.7%) power to a gain after the automaker's Q3 report doesn't...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +7.7%) power to a gain after the automaker's Q3 report doesn't raise anything too alarming to investors. In a letter (.pdf) to shareholders, the company calls the quarter a "fundamental turning point" for the company as it shifts into a higher gear of production. New showrooms and an expanded supercharger network are also in the works.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 10 Comments
  • ARUN

    Volatile Aruba Networks (ARUN +5%) is among the day's big tech winners. The high price/sales...

    Volatile Aruba Networks (ARUN +5%) is among the day's big tech winners. The high price/sales multiples implied by rival Ruckus Wireless' IPO price range could be leading some to view Aruba, which had 24.1% of its float shorted on Oct. 15, as cheap by comparison.  FQ1 results are due on Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • KZIA

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +50%. ICAD +43%. NTE +36%. HMNY +19%. BMRN +30%. OPTT +25%. VRNG...

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +50%. ICAD +43%. NTE +36%. HMNY +19%. BMRN +30%. OPTT +25%. VRNG +23%. EQU +15%. BEE +13%. BITA +12%.
    Top 10 Losers: EBIX -22%. HGSH -19%. RDN -14%. PCYC -12%. MEAD -15%. VTUS -10%. PKBK -10%. COCO -9%. OTC:PGRX -9%. ENZ -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT -8.3%) is off sharply after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Janney, which...

    Velti (VELT -8.3%) is off sharply after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Janney, which cites ongoing weakness in Europe. The mobile ad agency, which reports after the close on Nov. 14, derived 55% of its Q2 revenue from Europe (including the U.K.). Americas sales, which made up 29% of revenue, are growing much faster.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +22.7%) is up sharply as the jury deliberating over the Google trial reportedly...

    Vringo (VRNG +22.7%) is up sharply as the jury deliberating over the Google trial reportedly asks for instructions on damages. 77.1% of Vringo's float was shorted as of Oct. 15, though that number may have changed significantly since then in light of how volatile Vringo shares have been.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 5 Comments
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD -5.4%) shares sink after the maker of filtration and purification products says...

    Pall (PLL-OLD -5.4%) shares sink after the maker of filtration and purification products says its FQ1 will be challenging due to foreign exchange headwinds which will reduce EPS by $0.07-$0.10. PLL expects full-year earnings to be at the low end of its $3.05-$3.25 previously issued guidance. (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • DNDN

    William Blair is cutting its price target to $4 from $5 on Dendreon (DNDN -5.2%) after Friday's...

    William Blair is cutting its price target to $4 from $5 on Dendreon (DNDN -5.2%) after Friday's Q3 showed Provenge sales missing expectations. The firm says sales of the drug are likely to remain challenged over the near term, and keeps an Underperform rating on the stock. CFO Doug Schiffman acknowledged in the company's earning call on Friday that the drug has faced some marketing challenges over the past quarter due in part to the departure of some key sales personnel in many of its key markets. (Transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMLP

    Inergy Midstream (NRGM +2.2%) agrees to acquire Rangeland Energy, owner and operator of the COLT...

    Inergy Midstream (NRGM +2.2%) agrees to acquire Rangeland Energy, owner and operator of the COLT crude oil rail terminal, storage, and pipeline facilities in North Dakota's Bakken and Three Forks shale areas, for $425M. NRGM will sell $225M of common units in a private placement and has obtained committed unsecured debt financing to fund the acquisition. NRGY +4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • CGG-OLD

    CGGVeritas (CGV -2.7%) reports a 20% increase in Q3 profit to $48M vs. $40M in the year-ago...

    CGGVeritas (CGV -2.7%) reports a 20% increase in Q3 profit to $48M vs. $40M in the year-ago period but misses estimates partly because of a higher tax rate. Separately, the world’s largest seismic surveyor of oilfields agrees to work with Baker Hughes (BHI +1.3%) to provide shale drilling services.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • DBD

    A U.S. Appeals Court has affirmed a lower court ruling that Diebold (DBD +2%) did not infringe...

    A U.S. Appeals Court has affirmed a lower court ruling that Diebold (DBD +2%) did not infringe upon a patent awarded to Voter Verified for certain "automated systems and methods for voting in an election."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • QGEN

    Qiagen (QGEN +1.1%) gains after its Q3 beat on all counts this morning. On paper, net earnings...

    Qiagen (QGEN +1.1%) gains after its Q3 beat on all counts this morning. On paper, net earnings fell 17% Y/Y, but that number is skewed from a one-time acquisition gain, which masked a 10% rise in total revenue over the same period last year. The company has struggled in recent quarters as patients reduced their use of health-care services, but early this year the company completed a streamlining process which gave a big boost to bottom line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -2.2%) slump even further after Walgreen's monthly sales report comes in...

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -2.2%) slump even further after Walgreen's monthly sales report comes in weak. Traders are latching on to underlying trends in the sector that look weak even after stripping out the effect of Hurricane Sandy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC -11.8%) trades lower today after beating on FQ1 revenue but coming up short...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC -11.8%) trades lower today after beating on FQ1 revenue but coming up short on its EPS. Earnings came in at $1.07 per share, below consensus expectations of $1.15. Revenues were $102.7M - due primarily to a large milestone payment from Janssen Pharmaceuticals - easily beating the Street estimate of $99.74M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • HES

    Hess (HES +2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $65 target price, raised from $53, at...

    Hess (HES +2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $65 target price, raised from $53, at Global Hunter, which represents 71% of the firm's pre-tax NAV estimate; HES is trading at a price-to-NAV of 58% vs. 72% median for peers. After some bumps in the road, including a poorly received capex boost, the firm believes HES' plan to scale back and refocus is taking shape.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -26.2%) plummets as Bloomberg reports the SEC has been probing its accounting...

    Ebix (EBIX -26.2%) plummets as Bloomberg reports the SEC has been probing its accounting practices over the last year. The cloud insurance software firm's revenue recognition, internal controls, and information accuracy are all being probed, according to three sources. Chairman/CEO Robin Raina and an attorney representing Ebix claim to have no knowledge of an SEC investigation. Ebix bears such as SA's Copperfield Research have long criticized its accounting.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • XCO

    Exco Resources (XCO +3.8%) announces a partnership with Philip Falcone's Harbinger Group (HRG...

    Exco Resources (XCO +3.8%) announces a partnership with Philip Falcone's Harbinger Group (HRG +2.7%) where XCO will contribute its conventional non-shale assets in east Texas and Louisiana and its shallow Canyon Sand and other assets in west Texas to a limited partnership. EXCO will $597M in cash, a 24.5% limited partner interest and a 50% interest in the general partner.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE +1.5%) is up a bit after Lazard upgrades shares to Buy. The e-commerce software...

    Demandware (DWRE +1.5%) is up a bit after Lazard upgrades shares to Buy. The e-commerce software provider, which has decent European exposure and has begun to see stronger competition from NetSuite, reports Q3 results before tomorrow's open.
